thesis.summary: Carl Icahn (Tier-2) value realization phase following Centuri separation. Pure-play regulated gas utility now. Board resignation (Andrew Teno, Dec 31 2025) signals transition to endgame (sale or strategic value unlock).
thesis.catalyst: Value realization via sale or strategic action

decision.rationale: Score 10.0 exceeds threshold 8.25. Highest conviction setup following de-risking of business model. Pure-play utility status makes it clean acquisition target.

thesis_break_triggers: Icahn fully exits position (13D filing showing <5% stake)
Major regulatory setback to utility operations

monitoring.notes: Same-day entry monitoring. Price essentially flat (-0.1%). No mainstream media coverage. IV data unavailable. Icahn holds 8.48% stake (above 5% threshold). Positive development: Amended cooperation agreement with 4 Icahn board seats at 2026 annual meeting. Yellow flag: Icahn has been reducing position (sales in Nov 2024, March 2025), but board engagement suggests ongoing commitment to value realization.
Price slightly up to 80.46. No new media signals. Holding.

Price up +0.9% from entry. No new mainstream media coverage in January 2026. Yellow flag: Icahn reduced position -21.8% in Q1 2025, but maintains 8.48% stake (above 5% threshold) with 4 board seats secured via cooperation agreement. Board engagement suggests ongoing value realization commitment. 3.6% progress to target (well below 50% threshold). No exit signals triggered.

Price up +1.7% from entry. Above 200-day MA ($81.79 > $76.87) = strong technical positioning. No new mainstream media coverage in January 2026. Icahn maintains 8.48% stake with 4 board seats per cooperation agreement. 6.9% progress to target (well below 50% threshold). No exit signals triggered. Position performing as expected. Data sources: IBKR Paper (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).

Strong performance! Price up +6.9% from entry at $86.01, well above $73 stop. Above 200-day MA ($86.01 > $76.99) = strong technical positioning. No new mainstream media coverage in January 2026 (info parity NOT triggered). Icahn maintains 8.48% stake with 4 board seats via amended cooperation agreement through 2026. 28.5% progress to target (below 50% threshold). No exit signals triggered. Pure-play utility value thesis intact. Data sources: Stooq (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).
